body:
Comment 9: 
Minux is correct. You should build using the go1.2 in the main repo, and the head of
release-branch.go1.2 in the go.tools repo.

The binary distributions were rolled using those commits at launch, but I reserve the
right to reproduce them at any time using go.tools from the release-branch.go1.2 head.

If you really, really want to have a fully reproducible build then I suggest you hard
code the relevant go.tools revision somewhere. I don't want to start tagging releases in
sub-repositories.
